ðŸ’¡ pose2sim | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To enable markerless 3D motion capture and kinematic analysis from readily available camera footage, providing an accessible and accurate alternative to traditional motion capture systems.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Markerless 3D kinematics â€¢ Supports any cameras (phones, webcams, GoPros)
ðŸ“– Summary: Pose2Sim is a Python-based workflow for markerless 3D human and animal kinematics, transforming 2D pose estimations from various sources into detailed 3D motion data compatible with OpenSim. It offers a cost-effective, accurate, and robust alternative to traditional marker-based motion capture, suitable for sports, clinical, and animation applications.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ ease-master | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide frontend developers with an intuitive visual tool to create, preview, and export custom animation easing curves for various frameworks and CSS.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Cubic Bezier Editor â€¢ Spring Physics Engine â€¢ Multi-Framework Export (CSS, Tailwind, Framer Motion, GSAP) â€¢ Advanced Preview Playground â€¢ Smart Presets (Industry Standards, OS-style springs)
ðŸ“– Summary: EaseMaster is a web-based tool for visualizing and generating animation easing curves. It allows users to design custom Cubic Bezier curves or tune spring physics parameters, then export production-ready code for CSS, Tailwind CSS, Framer Motion, and GSAP.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ winshot | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Capturing, annotating, and exporting screenshots efficiently on Windows with a user-friendly interface and advanced editing capabilities.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multiple capture modes (Fullscreen, Region, Window, Hotkey) â€¢ Rich annotation tools (Shapes, Arrows, Text, Numbers, Spotlight) â€¢ Non-destructive editing and cropping â€¢ Multiple export formats (PNG, JPEG) and ratios â€¢ System tray integration and global hotkeys
ðŸ“– Summary: WinShot is a modern, lightweight screenshot tool for Windows that offers advanced capture modes, rich annotation tools, non-destructive editing, and flexible export options. It aims to provide a superior user experience with a glassmorphism UI and significantly smaller file size compared to Electron-based applications.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ MineContext | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To act as an intelligent assistant that understands a user's digital context and proactively provides relevant information and task management.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Proactive context-aware AI partner â€¢ Screenshot and content comprehension â€¢ Multimodal information support (future) â€¢ Contextual engineering framework â€¢ Delivers insights, summaries, to-do lists, activity records
ðŸ“– Summary: MineContext is a proactive, context-aware AI partner that integrates with your digital world to provide insights, summaries, and task management. It leverages screenshots and multimodal information to understand your context and deliver relevant information proactively.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ dexter | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Performing deep financial research and analysis autonomously by answering complex financial questions.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Intelligent Task Planning â€¢ Autonomous Execution â€¢ Self-Validation â€¢ Real-Time Financial Data Access â€¢ Safety Features (loop detection, step limits)
ðŸ“– Summary: Dexter is an autonomous financial research agent built with TypeScript that leverages task planning, self-reflection, and real-time market data to answer complex financial questions. It breaks down queries into executable steps, gathers data, validates its findings, and synthesizes them into comprehensive, data-backed answers.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ superpowers | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To automate and structure the software development workflow for AI coding agents, enabling them to produce high-quality code more autonomously and efficiently.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Composable skills for coding agents â€¢ Interactive design refinement (brainstorming) â€¢ Automated implementation plan generation â€¢ Subagent-driven development process â€¢ Emphasis on TDD, YAGNI, and DRY principles
ðŸ“– Summary: Superpowers provides a comprehensive software development workflow for coding agents, built upon a modular system of 'skills'. It guides agents through a structured process from initial idea refinement to final code implementation and review, emphasizing best practices like TDD and YAGNI.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
